title: U.S. Department of Energy Awards Team Led by Ginkgo Bioworks Funding to Develop Algal Crop Protection Solutions - PR Newswire
summary: Ginkgo Bioworks has received funding from the U.S. Department of Energy to develop a new method for protecting algae crops from microscopic pests. This new method uses antimicrobial peptides (AMPs), which are naturally occurring substances that kill microbes, to protect the algae from pests. This research aims to improve the sustainability and productivity of algae-based biotechnologies for producing biofuels and bioproducts.
product_or_process: Algal Crop Protection Solutions using AMPs

title: Unprecedented solar and storage growth on horizon with record installations and investments in U.S. - pv magazine International
summary: The U.S. is making significant strides toward a clean energy future, with renewable energy sources like solar and wind power gaining traction. The Inflation Reduction Act and Bipartisan Infrastructure Law are driving investments in clean energy manufacturing and battery storage, leading to substantial growth in the solar and energy storage sectors.  The article highlights the rapid expansion of battery storage capacity, particularly for utility-scale installations, and provides a ranking of top installers in the U.S. distributed generation market.

title: Dover Completes Acquisition of FW Murphy - PR Newswire
summary: Dover Corporation, a diversified global manufacturer, has acquired the business of FW Murphy Production Controls, LLC. This acquisition will become part of Dover's Pumps & Process Solutions segment, contributing to Dover's portfolio of innovative equipment and components, and software solutions. Dover is known for its entrepreneurial approach and its team of over 25,000 employees works collaboratively with customers to redefine possibilities.

title: How did the top smartphone makers fare in sustainability in 2023? - Rappler
summary: The article examines the sustainability efforts of several major smartphone manufacturers, including Apple, Xiaomi, Honor, Realme, OPPO, Samsung, Fairphone, Huawei, and Vivo.  The companies are adopting various strategies to reduce their environmental impact, such as using recycled materials, promoting energy efficiency, and extending product lifespans.  However, the article notes that while some initiatives are promising, the industry still has a long way to go in becoming truly sustainable.

title: Millennium Welt, Gentari break ground on EV charging flagship store - theSun
summary: Millennium Welt, a BMW dealer, and Gentari Malaysia, a clean energy provider, have partnered to open an EV Charging Flagship Store in Kuala Lumpur. The facility, powered by renewable energy, will offer a unique charging experience with 14 charging points, including high-speed 240kW DC chargers, and a showroom showcasing 66 electric vehicles. This initiative marks a significant step towards advancing electric mobility in Southeast Asia.

title: ENERtec Asia 2024: Driving Sustainable Urban and Industrial Energy Transition in Southeast Asia - PR Newswire

title: NWTN Announces Strategic Partnership with China State Construction Engineering Corporation (Middle East) - PR Newswire
summary: NWTN Inc., an eco-conscious mobility technology company, has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with China State Construction Engineering Corporation (Middle East) LLC (CSCEC) to collaborate on sustainable development projects. The partnership focuses on developing new energy vehicles and green hydrogen projects in various regions, leveraging the companies' expertise to enhance their market competitiveness and brand influence. This agreement marks a significant stride in international cooperation and sustainable development, with the potential to set new standards in the industry.
